subject: Travel
title: Engineering Without Machines
description: A quick, practical guide to Engineering Without Machines.

hook.text: The ancient world had no cranes, no engines, no power tools. Yet it built skyscrapers of stone.

buildup.text: Builders used simple tools: copper chisels, wooden levers, and ropes made from papyrus.

discovery.text: The real secret was organization. Thousands of workers coordinated with military precision.

twist.text: At Stonehenge, builders moved 25-ton stones 150 miles using only rafts and rollers.

climax.text: Every ancient wonder was built with tools a child could hold. Scale came from teamwork.

punchline.text: Great engineering starts with great coordination.

quiz.question: What was the key advantage ancient builders relied on?
